channel.title: Data Analytics on H. Shamil Samsudeen
channel.description: Recent content in Data Analytics on H. Shamil Samsudeen

item.title: Fiera Real Estate: Predictive Modeling for Canadian Real Estate
item.description: This was a Capstone Project which used census data, CBRE data and Python to program a model that can be repeatedly used to help with data backed decision making for real estate investments which aims to minimize the risk associated with high value asset investment. The regression model developed is able to predict vacancy rates for geographical locations using 6 major variables. These final variables include Total Available Inventory, Availability Rate, Average Asking Sale Price $/sq.

item.title: Safe Roads Competition 2021
item.description: This project was a submission in the Safe Roads Competition 2021 hosted by SAS, Geotab and the Toronto Police Services. The objective of this project was to investigate factors that contributes to vehicle collisions with cyclists, and the impact of drivingbehavior and compliance with traffic regulations oncyclist safety. The data used for this study was from the KSI (Killed or Seriously Injured) dataset provided by the Toronto Police services and additional data from the Geotab Ignition hazardous areas and road impediments dataset were used.

item.title: Kaggle competition - Learning from disaster
item.description: This project was a submission in the learning from disaster Kaggle competition. Logistic Regression analysis predicted whether a passenger would survive based on the data available, the final models prediction accuracy was 77%. This project required more time spent on data cleaning and analysis. Key learnings from this project were methods of handling missing data, inference from statistical analysis and an introduction to Support Vector Regression analysis. Project Files - GitHub Repository link

item.title: Business Startup Analytics - Canadian children's retail market
item.description: This project uses the Canadian Census data for the year 2016, which was published by Statistics Canada. In order to understand the children’s retail market, with a mission of helping set up new store locations for businesses. This analysis would help businesses understand it’s potential consumers in age groups below 20, population distributions for this demography, purchasing power, and potential market growth opportunities. The key business questions were; Selecting the top locations for setting up new childrens retail stores.

item.title: Association Analysis - Catalog Cross Selling
item.description: This group project required performing an association analysis to develop rules and collaborative filtering. The group acted as a team of analysts for an hypothetical organisation. The team presented the final results in order to help the hypothetical business make an informed decision on which catalog to promote in a direct-mail marketing campaign focused on cross-selling. Project Files - GitHub Repository link
